title: Sunderland halt pursuit of Swansea's Andre Ayew as Sam Allardyce rules out Debuchy move
title_page: Sunderland halt pursuit of Swansea's Andre Ayew as Sam Allardyce rules out Debuchy move | Daily Mail Online
text:
Deal for Arsenal defender Mathieu Debuchy also looks unlikely
Sam Allardyce admits he can't see Swansea selling Andre Ayew
Sam Allardyce has confirmed that Sunderland have called off their attempts to sign Swansea striker Andre Ayew.
The Black Cats were preparing an offer of £10million plus Fabio Borini for the 26-year-old Frenchman, who only joined the Swans in the summer.
But Allardyce said: ‘Have we given up? Yes.
Sam Allardyce has confirmed Sunderland have called off their attempts to sign Swansea striker Andre Ayew
Ayew, who scored against Everton on Sunday, only joined the Welsh club in the summer but will not be leaving
‘I can’t see Swansea selling Andre Ayew. I never really thought they would to be honest, and we haven’t put a bid in. It was a bit more speculation about whether Swansea would let him go.’
And Allardyce says that his pursuit of Arsenal defender Mathieu Debuchy is another deal which looks unlikely to happen.
‘I’m not sure he really wants to leave Arsenal, or that Arsene Wenger would let him go,’ explained the Sunderland boss.
Allardyce says his pursuit of Arsenal defender Mathieu Debuchy is also unlikely to happen
Uruguay international and former Liverpool defender Sebastian Coates is set to join Sporting Lisbon on loan
The arrival of £5m Lorient centre-back Lamine Kone has pushed Coates out of the door at the Stadium of Light
Meanwhile, Black Cats defender Sebastian Coates is set to join Sporting Lisbon on loan following the arrival of £5m Lorient centre-back Lamine Kone at the Stadium of Light.
Allarydce added: ‘It’s a balancing act, and if we move people out it helps free up wages.
‘Jordi Gomez may go, and then there’s also Adam Matthews, who might go somewhere to play some football.’
